version_description:
- Added a coin system where you earn coins for finding mines and completing games. You can use these coins to unlock themes!
- Added 4 new gorgeous retro themes!
- Added 8-bit sounds to match the retro styled skins! (Sounds are muted by default)
- Modified the ending-board to show total coin earnings after the game. This can be switched back to its original version in the settings menu
- Added rewarded video ads
- Performance improvements

- Added Extreme difficulty (30 x 24 - 180 mines)
- Increased the maximum columns to 24 for Custom mode
- Tap number: Press on an open cell to reveal the cells surrounding it. This will only work if the surrounding cells are safe to open or if the surrounding mines have been flagged correctly (Enable/Disable in Settings)
- Continue: If you hit a mine you can continue from where you left off for 50 coins or by watching a video ad (Enable/Disable in Settings)
- Added Extreme and Combined (Easy - Medium - Hard - Extreme) leaderboards
- Added French as an option in the Language window
- Fixed a sound bug

- 5 new themes! (including the Halloween theme) *player request*
- New Shop: You can now buy coins and remove pop-up ads (rewarded video ads will still be available) *player request*
- Accessibility: Option for left-handed players to change the layout of some windows for better usability (toggle in advanced settings)

- Hold to flag: You can now choose to disable this function in advanced settings
- The 'Highlight cell when pressed' setting is now located in advanced settings
- The 'Continue' window now includes the shop button
- The 'Themes' and 'Continue' windows were changed for better accessibility
- Minor bug fixes

Some of these additions were added upon your requests. You can request a feature by leaving a review. Thank you for making Minesweeper Classic: Retro even better. Enjoy!

• Hints: The hint system is now more advanced. It first scans the board for very obvious moves and then scans again for more advanced moves such as finding safe squares, guaranteed but not obvious mines and 1-2 patterns. A hint will always show an area where you are guaranteed to make a move considering that you have not made a mistake. Please keep in mind that hint system thinks like a player and does not know the locations of the mines. It takes the positions of your flags into consideration and will trust that you have placed them correctly. Basically, hints do not know it all and are there to guide you to areas where you can continue. Hint colors are different for every theme and do not indicate the complexity of a hint. Hints will now move the board so you can see the area it is showing. You can turn this off in advanced settings
• New Game Window: Making custom games is now more intuitive. When setting the row, column or mine number you will see a visual of what the board will look like. The mines on the visual you see are only a demonstration of how the board will look so you can understand the density of the mines. The locations of the mines will be random as always when playing the game. Sliders will now expand so you can set the numbers easier. You can turn both the visual and slider expanding off in advanced settings
• Optimization: The game code is now more efficient so expect better performance when playing. The game clock and time based actions such as long presses are now more accurate and will not be affected by frame rate drops
• Stats: A stat will not be shown if nothing has been recorded for that stat. An achievements button has been added to the Stats window. A new record text will appear when you win the game if you have beaten your previous record for the difficulty you were playing at
• Languages: Arabic and Hebrew languages have been added
• Shop: The shop window is now more intuitive. You can now see the prices of the items before prompting a purchase window. 2 more coin packs have been added (45000 coins and 99999 coins). You can use the slider to view through different coin packs. A ’2x Coins’ purchase has been added. This will multiply your winnings by 2 at the end of a game. If you are unable to see any prices in the Shop window please make sure you have an internet connection and relaunch the game.
• Miscellaneous: You can now disable flag animations in advanced settings. An animation has been added for when you win the game which can be turned off in advanced settings. You can now make the frame go transparent when you zoom in which creates a very cool effect, this can be turned on in advanced settings. After you hit a mine the board will now move so that the mine you hit and its surroundings are in the frame.

Thank you for playing Minesweeper Classic: Retro and also supporting us to make this game better. If you find any problems with the game, are confused about something in the game, want to see more features, have any theme suggestions, have any complaints or issues, or have any opinions about the game, please leave a review or email still57games@gmail.com. We love hearing your feedback so please don't hesitate tell us what you think, positive or negative, all are welcome. Enjoy the new update!
